gurmukhi: ju`D krq kbhU nhI hwrw ] kwl blI iqh Awn sMGwrw ]3]218]
transliteration: Juddh Karat Kab-hoo Nahihaaraa|| Kaal Balitih Aan Sanhaaraa||3||218||
translation: He was never defeated while fighting, but the mighty death came and killed him.3.218.

gurmukhi: qhwN BIm kurrwj isauN ju`D micE ]
transliteration: Tahaan Bheem Kur-raaj Sioun Juddh Machio||
translation: There the fierce war of Duryodhana began with Bhim,

gurmukhi: CtI bHm qwrI mhwN rudR nicE ]
translation: Because of which the meditation of Shiva was shattered and that great gods began to dance.
Because of the blows of warriors terrible sound arose;

gurmukhi: Bey ruMf muMfM qxM q`C qIrM ]1]219]
transliteration: Bhae Round Mounndan Tanan Tachchh Tderan||1||219||
translation: The bodies were pierced by arrows and the heads were separated from pierced by arrows and the heads were separated from the trunks.1.219.
Fighting in various ways, many warriors fell in the field;

gurmukhi: igry A`D A`DM CuDM ssqR DwrM ]
transliteration: Gire Addh Addhan Chhudhan Sastra Dhaaran||
translation: Many had fallen in halves who had been hungry of the sharp edges of weapons.
The intoxicated elephants of Kauravas had been chopped in the field.
Seeing the brave warriors wields weapons in the field, the vultures were feeling pleased.2.220.
The warriors were fighting in the battlefield in enclosures.
They laughed, roared and patted their arms, they challenged from both sides.
They were standing and showing feats of bravery in enclosures.
They swayed their arms and were producing terrible sounds with the blows of their maces.3.221.
